main event: A reddish glow with a vertical tail was observed by a military pilot and crew over Goose Bay, Labrador on September 22, 1959.
interesting points: The object was observed from an altitude of 20,000 feet by the crew of Pan American flight 114 traveling from New York to London.
The object was described as a 'space rocket' moving from south to north with a vertical tail.
The object was sighted over the east coast of Labrador at around 11:00 PM local time.
The crew's impression was that the object might have been the last stage of a rocket that had left the atmosphere and was descending due to the rotation of the Earth.
Due to the limited information received, a valid evaluation of the sighting could not be made.
witnesses: military pilot and crew, crew of Pan American flight 114
